website_summaries.verdict: Conquer barbells, dumbbells, and pull-ups with these slip-free weight hooks.
pros: These hooks are perfectly positioned to add more stability to your gym routine
The thick pads fully support your wrist if you’re recovering from injury, and each hook is covered in reliable non-stick coating to prevent movement
Allows open and closed grips for a variety of back workouts and muscle targeting
cons: These are a better fit for lifters with smaller hands and wrists
The hooks are also on the petite size, which may prevent use with Olympic-size barbells

customer_reviews.title: It's fine- not good for small hands
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these. Some ladies in my gym recommended them because my grip was trash. I tried them out for months. While they did help me lift heavier, I couldn't even wrap my hands around the bar because the grips stick out too far. The hooks were the only thing holding the weight. I ended up finally getting the versapro grips. I recommend those wayyyyy over these. Those allow you to wrap your hands around the bar and continue to strengthen your grip while still lifting much heavier.
customer_reviews.author: Skol5691

customer_reviews.title: Good for Deadlifts, not Good for Clean & Jerks or other Over-The-Head Exercises
customer_reviews.text: As the headline says. I do both types of exercises in a single set, so it was impractical for me to use these. They actually gave me a bruise in my hands below the thumb from trying to do Clean & Jerks... I returned them and found a softer piece of equipment that achieved the same goal. Returns were hassle-free, and if you only need this for Deadlifts, I would say they are a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: NOBA

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend was paralyzed in an accident a little over a year ago and initially lost a lot of strength/mobility in his arms. Bought these to try at our local gym, and they’ve been a huge success! He can use our weight system (even without hand/finger function) and has gotten so much back already.
customer_reviews.author: Ash S.

customer_reviews.title: They are comfortable and are generally well made
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a friend that was having problems with her grip. They were too big for her so she gave them back and I have been using them for a few months. They are comfortable and are generally well made. The one problem I had is the steel piece used to hold the straps in place is rather flimsy and gets bent if you lift with lots of weight. These work well for just about everything except deadlifts.
customer_reviews.author: K. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Very solid. Will do exactly what they are made to do. Super strong velcro and beefy metal hooks. I use these for pull-downs, seated rows, bent over single arm rows, and other miscellaneous movement. This has helped to train around my forearm/elbow pain.
customer_reviews.author: BeauDiesel

customer_reviews.title: Fits only very petite wrists. These are not the lifting hooks you are looking for.
customer_reviews.text: The hooks are not like the picture. They do not hang to your fingers. hang in your palm. And the wrist straps are so small they will not wrap my wrists or my wife's. Literally wont even touch velcro to velcro. I attached a photo showing the large gap between the Velcro strips. Seller did refund my money without hassle or complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Hatfield

customer_reviews.title: but they are great after the initial learning period
customer_reviews.text: These are helpful for deadlifts. It takes a little practice to use them, but they are great after the initial learning period. You want to make sure there is no slack once you begin the deadlift pull. I found that when my grip would start to fail, the rest of my form would start to suffer. I got through 3 sets at a weight I have been stuck on for weeks much easier using these. I only do 1 heavy weight lifting session a week for general fitness. I don't do olympic lifts.
customer_reviews.author: jdh

customer_reviews.title: Not built for big wrists
customer_reviews.text: These lifting hooks work pretty well and I've been able to do some training while I've been rehabbing an injury to my left hand. However I must warn that they do not seem to be built for large wrists. When I secure them tightly, I have about an inch of velcro to secure them, which makes me a bit cautious for lifting heavy. I will keep using them, but won't go heavy with them, regular lifting straps seem the more secure option.
customer_reviews.author: Ross M. Engel

customer_reviews.title: I never leave product reviews.
customer_reviews.text: It’s awesome. I always hated doing legs and deadlifts because I’d always have to get the straps perfect before I did them but now it’s all I do. I love these things so much that I’ve tried to use them on things they’re not even meant for, like curls for example (didn’t work btw).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Has helped me not to rely on finger/thumb strength to ...
customer_reviews.text: Has helped me not to rely on finger/thumb strength to do my lifting. Was having left thumb pain and this has really helped a lot. Relieves the stress of the grip and lets the hooks support the weight so I can focus on targeting the muscles without stopping short of my capability.
customer_reviews.author: cenobite

customer_reviews.title: only for men not for women
customer_reviews.text: These are great! But only for guys. My wrists Are 6.5 inches. Super huge cuffs and uncomfortable and hooks to far apart for ladies.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful for deadlifting and power shrugs
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality. I had an older set of hooks that I use for power shrugs and deadlifts but I lost them, so I bought these. They fit a standard Olympic bar perfectly and don't slide thanks to the rubber grips. I highly recommend using these instead of straps. They're much quicker to get on the bar and also more effective.
customer_reviews.author: SlayerTKE414

customer_reviews.title: Arrived on time Product is sturdy and seems to grip well It’s a little getting ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time Product is sturdy and seems to grip very well It’s going to take some getting used to since i have always used traditional wriststrap. I like them for now, but I don’t think theyre the wriststraps for every buyer.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: I love them and so did my lifting partner
customer_reviews.text: I use these all the time. I love them and so did my lifting partner. We were lifting heavy weight and not worrying about our grip. I could almost not even have a grip. (Bad on the wrist) lol Amazing product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G. Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Good assistant
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected but you will have to use some of your own grip strength as well or you'll pull your wrists out of socket. Its good at assisting, but not doing all the work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Zodiac

customer_reviews.title: Helped add both weight and reps to shurgs and deadlift
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love them. If you hate lifting straps like I do but still need some help holding on to the bar when your going heavy on shrugs or deadlift, then you want these hooks. When I go heavy on deadlift I usually feel a lot of pressure in my forearms and elbows while I try to hold on to the bar, these hooks helped ease that pressure and allowed me to add both weight and reps to my shrug and deadlift routine.
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: Must have for powerlifiting
customer_reviews.text: Prior to buying these my hands could barely hold 2 45lbs weights on either side of the barbell. My wrist would give away after 4 or 5 shrugs. Now I can do a set of 10 with 3 45lbs on either side. Even my wife noticed my shoulder definition.
customer_reviews.author: Pakitullanc

customer_reviews.title: I have 9" circumference wrists and the strap is too ...
customer_reviews.text: I have 9" circumference wrists and the strap is too short to give me a secure bite on the velcro.
customer_reviews.author: steve soto

customer_reviews.title: The wrist wraps are comfortable. The grips are very durable
customer_reviews.text: I have had a chance to use them for 1 workout. I'm a body builder so I can give you some feedback. The wrist wraps are comfortable. The grips are very durable. I did shrugs with 5 plates on each side and they held up well. I also did farmer carries with 90lb dumbbells and they did fine. My only issue would be that the hooks need to be a little farther apart. I would like to get 3 fingers between the hooks. They are a little too close. Other than that they are great.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth

customer_reviews.title: I love this item
customer_reviews.text: I have carpel tunnel so my grip is compromised whenever I do pull ups. These hooks were just the answer, so I can target my upper back muscles and not have to worry about my grip too much on the bars. They keep my wrists stable enough that I also use them when swinging my 30 lb bulgarian bag. I love this item!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to take the stress off of my forearms while doing exercises like pull-downs and low rows. They definitely help tremendously in that. Anyone experiencing or trying to avoid weightlifting induced tennis-elbow should give these a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce W. Sadosky Jr.

customer_reviews.title: they are amazing! I've been trying to get back into deadlifting ...
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried about the grip I would be able to get on the bar as the rods look rather thick. However, they are amazing! I've been trying to get back into deadlifting and am rather stuck at 405lbs, when I put on the lifting hooks is truly does take over from the grip perspective so 405 doesn't feel nearly as heavy. This allows me to truly focus on back development, and I've been able to increase my deadlift by about 25 pounds. I'm also able to crank out a few extra pull ups!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Keene

customer_reviews.title: Works great but...
customer_reviews.text: The hooks work great but the wrist straps are short. In order to reach the Velcro I have to pull them so tight it cuts off the circulation in my hands
customer_reviews.author: newton

customer_reviews.title: Gripping
customer_reviews.text: Helps we’ll to pull more weights on pull down lateral
customer_reviews.author: Chk

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good So Far!
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for only a short time and while I have given them only limited use, they seem to have been made well. I feel confident in saying, however, that the manufacturer really seems to stand by its product, and wants to make sure I'm satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: F. Akel III

customer_reviews.title: trainer recommended this brand and product
customer_reviews.text: Used one time and fabric tore on corner edge. I am a female lifter who trains heavy as a female but certainly not a big guy or pro lifter by any means. Shocked at quality and disappointing, trainer recommended this brand and product. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: Help save your forearms and wrists
customer_reviews.text: Helped my workouts! I am a massage therapist and it helped take the pressure off my grip and I was able to increase weight. Would recommend highly!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Breeding

customer_reviews.title: A Great Gym Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is very well-made product that has been a great assist with heavy deadlifts, shoulder shrugs and pull-ups. I used different brands in the past and these are superior. A great value and I'm very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alain P.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely useless if you're doing deadlifts on a standard bar
customer_reviews.text: Definitely useless if you're doing deadlifts on a standard bar . Maybe these are better for pull ups on the slim bar?
customer_reviews.author: Book lover!

customer_reviews.title: Must have for a weak grip
customer_reviews.text: I dislocated one of my fingers and I can't grip a bar like i used to, but these wraps are changing all of that. I am getttin more pull ups and pull downs because of these things. Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent for small hands and helped to increase my max weight by 40% on all my back exercises. Highly recommend these. They reduced the forearm fatigue I was experiencing.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie P.

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: One of the hooks has a smaller gap, it gets stuck. I tried to fix it, but all I did was mess up the orange spongy coating. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: angelica

customer_reviews.title: You need these
customer_reviews.text: The best wrist straps I've bought to date !!! Really good for traps after your forearms are tired!!! Very secure and comfy!!!!! Deff a five star
customer_reviews.author: Topher

customer_reviews.title: good quality. Very comfortable to wear
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping, good quality. Very comfortable to wear, and user friendly. Seems like they will last a long time. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. I am able to deadlift a lot more weight for more reps
customer_reviews.author: Keshawn M. Hill

customer_reviews.title: These hooks were recommended to me by my coach and I absolutely love ...
customer_reviews.text: These hooks were recommended to me by my coach and I absolutely love them. They appear to be durable, fit my wrist and palm perfectly and help me lift heavier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Have already recommended them to many
customer_reviews.text: I have only used these once so far, but they are INCREDIBLE!! My grip always gives out on deadlifts, and this took care of the problem, allowing me to increase my weight as well as reps without having to stop for grip breaks. Have already recommended them to many!! I am a small woman and these fit great:)
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Harris

customer_reviews.title: Buy 'Em and Start Pulling!
customer_reviews.text: These have helped my Romanian Deadlifts, Sumo Deadlifts, and lat pulldowns. I'm not into having a bunch of gym gear, but these changed Back Day for me. Would buy again, great product.
customer_reviews.author: MississippiMusicEd

customer_reviews.title: The Best Hooks
customer_reviews.text: These things are perfect. There's an endless variety of exercises you can do with these weight lifting hooks. They work for dumbbell, barbell and cable exercises. I'd highly recommend them and couldn't be more satisfied with them.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Weak wrists? No problem.
customer_reviews.text: The hooks are great for me because I have weak wrists. Taken my workouts to a whole new level.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gramling

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price+
customer_reviews.text: Just bought a pair, I'm hitting the lats super heavy now, I definitely recommend these hooks
customer_reviews.author: Charles M.

customer_reviews.title: They were a great help to me in doing back extensions
customer_reviews.text: These do exactly what they say – they take over for your hands if your grip starts to loosen. They were a great help to me in doing back extensions, and I look forward to using them for dead lifts, too. They fit well, and there's plenty of Velcro to make sure they are not going anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality stitching
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly to the hand. Very good quality stitching, material.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Able to get in more reps with heavy weight without worrying about losing my grip. Fantastic product👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: victor gomez

customer_reviews.title: What I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I have had them for about a month and must say that these are awesome. Exactly what I needed. Has helped with both my dead lift and pull up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: works real well just to be able to hold the weight without the forearms getting tired.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Rojek

customer_reviews.title: Solid product.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product - I picked these up after using a pair my trainer had, these are definitely more comfortable. I feel confident when using these and they allow me to comfortably take my workouts to the next level.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Strong if you can use your hand for pulling excersizes
customer_reviews.author: Sb

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great hooks for shrugs .. Pulls ups . Rows Great customer service Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: France Occy

customer_reviews.title: O my gosh best purchase EVER
customer_reviews.text: O my gosh best purchase EVER!!!!! Great quality,takes all the work out of your arms and very fast delivery!!!! I LOVE THEM
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Skip These.
customer_reviews.text: I had really high hopes for these hooks. My #1 complaint is that they were too small for a majority of the barbells at my gym! Maybe it's my gym, but out Olympic size barbells were too thick to fit in the hooks... what a disappointment. Other than that, I felt that these were much lower quality than some of the other weigh lifting hooks out there.
customer_reviews.author: Rock

customer_reviews.title: These seem to be sturdy enough, however the hooks themselves make most lifts ...
customer_reviews.text: These seem to be sturdy enough, however the hooks themselves make most lifts very uncomfortable. I got these to assistance work with hanging exercises where my grip would give out before I was done with a set. The design of the two hooks make it impossible for me to hold onto the pullup bar in any way that would let me attempt to support myself as much as I could. Waste of money. Sticking with my old pair of fabric straps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: honestly these paid for reviews were and are horse crap..
customer_reviews.text: honestly these paid for reviews were and are horse crap... It's ok maybe really a 2 star at that. Even with that being said just go with a normal one not his high speed garbage...
customer_reviews.author: angie

customer_reviews.title: ... so much with my deads - I do my best to only use them later in my set and ...
customer_reviews.text: These help so much with my deads - I do my best to only use them later in my set and not rely on them, but it makes all the difference when you can concentrate on form instead of dropping the bar. They allow me to lift heavier than I would be able to otherwise. PLUS One of the hooks was too tight and wouldn't fit around the bar- I sent Lifting Lab an email and they immediately sent me a new set, free of charge.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great product. I had no idea what I was ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I had no idea what I was getting into when I ordered these and I'm so glad I did. They have enhanced my workouts and I'm able to lift heavier weight with support of the hooks. Very sturdy and solid. Makes doing pull-ups more interesting! I'm glad I got these. I will covet them.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Piccoli

customer_reviews.title: Unless your deadlifting a VW bug these are for you.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, 500lbs these things handle it easily.
customer_reviews.author: bo dake

customer_reviews.title: Don't let your hand strength dictate your back growth!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had these when I started training years ago... my grip strength has been holding me back all this time! As soon as I tried these out I added 20 pounds to my deadlift and I'm looking forward to my back days in a way I never have before. I have a home gym and I'll probably have to start buying more plates to put on the bar!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought these for my husband and he loves them ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband and he loves them. He has used them several times and he lives the quality of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Looks pretty nice, havent tried it yet but it looks better than the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Champion Level
customer_reviews.text: These are definite game changers. I'm a Physique competitor and coach for the 2016 San Francisco Physique Champions #teamblakefit
customer_reviews.author: blake harrison

customer_reviews.title: Must have for heavy lifters
customer_reviews.text: Great tool when lifting heavy but not wanting Popeye forearms
customer_reviews.author: Jared

product_meta.title: Lifting Lab | Weight Lifting Hooks with Non Slip Coating and Thick Neoprene Padded Wrist Wraps Designed for Grip Assist During Deadlifts, Rows, Pulldowns, and Shrugs
feature_bullets: BENEFITS - Whether you’re trying to increase your max on a deadlift, take the strain off of an annoying injury, or better engage and isolate back muscles you’ll feel an immediate difference when you use a great set of weight lifting hooks
WELL SHAPED COATED HOOKS - These fit perfectly around standard barbells, dumbbells, and machine attachments like lat pulldown bars.

CHOOSE BETWEEN OPEN OR CLOSED GRIP - thick, fully adjustable pads cushion and support your wrist allowing you to open your hand and take the strain off of your grip (helps alleviate pain from tendonitis, golfers elbow, and causes the weight to be transferred to larger back muscles instead of your grip and forearms).
IMMEDIATELY INCREASE YOUR WEIGHT AND REPS during deadlifts, shrugs, lat pulldowns, pull-ups, seated cable rows - any movements that target the posterior chain (back, traps, glutes, hamstrings).
You'll feel the quality on the first rep!
